1.name: All Quiet on the Western Front
1.description: A young soldier faces profound disillusionment in the soul-destroying horror of World War I.

2.name: Hell's Angels
2.description: Brothers Monte and Ray leave Oxford to join the Royal Flying Corps. Ray loves Helen; Helen enjoys an affair with Monte; before they leave on their mission over Germany they find her in still another man's arms.

3.name: The Big Trail
3.description: Breck Coleman leads hundreds of settlers in covered wagons from the Mississippi River to their destiny out West.

4.name: Anna Christie
4.description: A young woman reunites with her estranged father and falls in love with a sailor, but struggles to tell them about her dark past.

5.name: L'Age d'Or
5.description: A surrealist tale of a man and a woman who are passionately in love with each other, but their attempts to consummate that passion are constantly thwarted by their families, the Church, and bourgeois society.

6.name: Animal Crackers
6.description: Mayhem and zaniness ensue when a valuable painting goes missing during a party in honor of famed African explorer Captain Spaulding.

7.name: Morocco
7.description: A cabaret singer and a Legionnaire fall in love, but their relationship is complicated by the results of his womanizing and due to the appearance of a rich man who wants her for himself.

8.name: Romance
8.description: Young Harry is in love and wants to marry an actress, much to the displeasure of his family. Harry thinks that Bishop Armstrong knows nothing about love so Armstrong tells him the story of ...                See full summary »

9.name: Der blaue Engel
9.description: An elderly professor's ordered life spins dangerously out of control when he falls for a nightclub singer.

10.name: King of Jazz
10.description: American Pre-Code color film starring Paul Whiteman and his Jazz orchestra.

11.name: Little Rascals: Best of Our Gang
11.description: Spanky, Buckwheat, Porky and all The Little Rascals at their hilarious best!

12.name: Murder!
12.description: A juror in a murder trial, after voting to convict, has second thoughts and begins to investigate on his own before the execution.

13.name: City Girl
13.description: A Chicago waitress falls in love with a Minnesota farmer, and decides to face a life in the country.

14.name: People on Sunday
14.description: Edwin, a taxi driver, lives with Annie, a neurasthenic model. They plan to spend Sunday at the Nikolassee beach with Wolfgang, an officer, gentleman, antiquarian, gigolo, at the moment a ...                See full summary »

15.name: The Divorcee
15.description: When a woman discovers that her husband has been unfaithful to her, she decides to respond to his infidelities in kind.

16.name: Abraham Lincoln
16.description: An episodic biography of the 16th President of the United States.

17.name: Ladies of Leisure
17.description: An upper-crust artist hires a 'party girl' as a model; romance follows.

18.name: Anna Christie
18.description: A young woman reunites with her estranged father and falls in love with a sailor, but struggles to tell them about her dark past.

19.name: The Big House
19.description: A convict falls in love with his new cellmate's sister, only to become embroiled in a planned break-out which is certain to have lethal consequences.

20.name: The Flirting Widow
20.description: Phyllis wants to marry Bobby, but Father won't permit it until older sister Celia weds. So Celia invents a military fiancée in Arabia, unimaginatively christens him John Smith, writes him a...                See full summary »

21.name: The Doorway to Hell
21.description: Despite his efforts to go straight, a young gangster keeps falling back into crime.

22.name: Zemlya
22.description: In the peaceful countryside, Vassily opposes the rich kulaks over the coming of collective farming.

23.name: Reaching for the Moon
23.description: Wall Street wizard, Larry Day, new to the ways of love, is coached by his valet. He follows Vivian Benton on an ocean liner, where cocktails, laced with a "love potion," work their magic. ...                See full summary »

24.name: Paramount on Parade
24.description: A musical revue that basically has Paramount stars and contract-players doing things some had never done on screen, and wouldn't again; such as Ruth Chatteron , in a French-café setting ...                See full summary »

25.name: Just Imagine
25.description: New York, 1980: airplanes have replaced cars, numbers have replaced names, pills have replaced food, government-arranged marriages have replaced love, and test tube babies have replaced ......                See full summary »

26.name: The Benson Murder Case
26.description: A ruthless, crooked stockbroker is murdered at his luxurious country estate, and detective Philo Vance just happens to be there; he decides to find out who killed him.

27.name: Up the River
27.description: When paroled trustee Steve and former inmate Judy who try to put their criminal lives behind them are blackmailed, two career criminals come to their rescue.

28.name: Sin Takes a Holiday
28.description: Dowdy Sylvia accepts her boss' marriage proposal, even though he only asked her to avoid marriage to another woman. As a wealthy wife, Sylvia changes from ugly duckling to uninhibited swan ...                See full summary »

29.name: The Bat Whispers
29.description: A master criminal terrorizes the occupants of an isolated country mansion.

30.name: Min and Bill
30.description: Min, the owner of a dockside hotel, is forced to make difficult decisions about the future of Nancy, the young woman she took in as an infant.

31.name: The Dawn Patrol
31.description: World War I ace Dick Courtney derides the leadership of his superior officer, but Courtney is soon promoted to squadron commander and learns harsh lessons about sending subordinates to their deaths.

32.name: Paid
32.description: Mary Turner goes up for three years on a crime she didn't commit. Once out she and former prison mates plan a scam in which old men can be sued for breach of promise - the "heart balm" ...                See full summary »

33.name: The Criminal Code
33.description: After a failed attempt at running for governor, D.A. Mark Brady is appointed warden of the state prison where many of the criminals he prosecuted are incarcerated.

34.name: Juno and the Paycock
34.description: During the Irish Civil War in 1922, a family earns a big inheritance. They start leading a rich life, forgetting what the most important values are.

35.description: Angela and Bob Brooks are an upper class couple. Unfortunately, Bob is an unfaithful husband. But Angela has a plan to win back her husband's affections. An elaborate masquerade ball is to ...                See full summary »

36.name: Puttin' on the Ritz
36.description: A vaudeville and nightclub performer becomes successful and forgets who his friends really are.

37.name: Montana Moon
37.description: While returning to Montana from a fling in New York, wealthy Joan Prescott leaves the train, intending to return to the big city. She runs into handsome cowboy Larry and gets engaged. On ...                See full summary »

38.name: Sous les toits de Paris
38.description: Albert is smitten for Pola but ends up wrongly committed in jail, in the meantime her affections are sought after by his friend, and on his release both love and friendship must be tested.

39.name: Tom Sawyer
39.description: The classic Mark Twain tale of a young boy and his friends on the Mississippi River. Tom and his pals Huckleberry Finn and Joe Harper have numerous adventures, including running away to be ...                See full summary »

40.name: Fast and Loose
40.description: A wealthy family is thrown into turmoil when the daughter falls for the family chauffeur and the son begins to keep company with a chorus girl.

41.name: Journey's End
41.description: In France, 1917, an alcoholic captain is afraid that his new replacement, his sweetheart's brother, will betray his downfall.

43.name: Prix de beauté (Miss Europe)
43.description: Lucienne, typist and gorgeous bathing beauty, decides to enter the 'Miss Europe' pageant sponsored by the French newspaper she works for. She finds her jealous lover Andre violently ...                See full summary »

44.name: The Unholy Three
44.description: "Talkie" remake of Tod Browning's 1925 silent film. A trio of former sideshow performers double as the "Unholy Three" in a scam to nab some shiny rocks.

45.name: The Naughty Flirt
45.description: Rich party girl sets her eyes on a young attorney.

46.name: Feet First
46.description: An ambitious shoe salesman unknowingly meets his boss' daughter and tells her he is a leather tycoon, then has to try to hide his true circumstances.

47.name: Her Man
47.description: Paris bargirl with tough "protector" falls for young sailor.

48.name: Monte Carlo
48.description: A countess flees to Monte Carlo on the day of her wedding, where she is courted by a count posing as a hairdresser.
